In Eq. 1, CE
ij refers to the CO 2 emissions by fossil fuel type i and sector j; AD
ij , the activity data, means the corresponding fossil fuel consumption. NCV
i , CC
i , and O
ij are known as emission factors. NCV
i refers to net caloric value, which is the heat value produced per physical unit of fossil fuel combusted (in J/ton); CC
i (carbon content) is the CO 2 emissions per net caloric value produced from a given fossil fuel type i (in metric tons of CO 2/J); O
ij is the oxygenation efficiency, which refers to the oxidation ratio when fossil fuels are burned (in %).
